result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan A. Bohn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 9 months county jail with huber stayed

Count 1 - 9 months county jail stayed and probation is imposed
   Probation 2 years - any assessments/counseling DOC may impose - no contact with Laura Korcenieski - absolute sobriety - restitution of $624.00 to be paid to Laura Korcenieski (clerk to forward this money directly to the victim) - costs - if revoked and jail is imposed they are consecutive to each other

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

$443.00 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Nathan A. Bohn in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  11:40 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites agreement - amend count 1 to CDTP 943.01(1) - misd.  plead to  and counts 2 and 3 to be amended to vacate the domestic abuse and plead to that - Probation 2 years - complete any assessments DOC may recomend. no contact with Laura korcenieski - absolute sobriety - rest. $624.00 to be paid before court (has been paid this to be paid to victim).  Court grants motions to amend.  DE entered plea of guilty to amended counts 1, 2 and 3.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty counts 1, 2 and 3.

Defendant Nathan A. Bohn in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  1:17 PM  Court calls case defendant appears late.  Court recalls case and recites appearances.  Court questions defendant as to his right to have a preliminary exam.  Defendant does not wish to have prelim.  Atty Verrilli addressed the court as he spoke to his client about the waiver of prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim. - finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court appeared by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Verrilli stated preliminary hearing to be waived, DEF didn't appear.    If DEF appears, court is to call Attorney Verrilli.

Defendant Nathan A. Bohn in court with attorney Michael A Verrilli by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Mr. Verrilli asks to appear by phone if Bohn plans to waive his rights.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF does not qualify for a public defender.  Michael Hoffman will not be representing him any longer, DEF in process of finding a new Atty.  Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for 6-23-15 @ 10:00 am.  Court sets bond.
